title: Arctic Weather Satellite: advancing weather forecasting in a changing climate
summary: The effects of the climate crisis are felt more acutely in the Arctic than anywhere else on the planet. The weather in the Arctic is not only severe, but it changes extremely quickly. More frequent data are urgently needed to improve weather forecasts for this susceptible polar region.

title: Launch Roundup: Progress MS-28, Indian SSLV, Chinese CZ-4B, and Falcon 9 flights scheduled
summary: The second full week of August is another busy one, with five flights scheduled including the final certification flight of a new launch vehicle from India. The Falcon 9 and Soyuz rockets were also scheduled to fly this week with one mission to the International Space Station and a pair of non-Starlink flights from both coasts of the United States.

title: Hydrosat to launch its first thermal infrared sensor
summary: SAN FRANCISCO – Washington-based startup Hydrosat is preparing to send its first thermal-infrared instrument into orbit July 8 on SpaceX’s Transporter-11 rideshare flight. The instrument, designed to measure water stress […]

title: Planet’s Tanager-1 Hyperspectral Satellite Ready for Launch
summary: Planet’s Tanager-1 Hyperspectral Satellite Ready for Launch

title: Planet’s first hyperspectral satellite is ready to launch
summary: Planet’s first hyperspectral satellite is ready for launch to help push the Earth observation operator to profitability by early next year.

title: Exolaunch Awarded First European Space Agency Launch Contract
summary:
German payload aggregator and in-space logistics company Exolaunch has been awarded a contract to launch the European Space Agency’s (ESA) Arctic Weather Satellite (AWS). In addition to being the first ESA launch contract awarded to the Berlin-based company, the awarding also marks a significant milestone for the agency as the first launch contract awarded through […]
The post Exolaunch Awarded First European Space Agency Launch Contract appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Capella to use SpaceX for two Acadia satellite launches
summary: Capella Space will launch two radar imaging satellites on SpaceX rideshare missions after an Electron launch failure disrupted its deployment plans.
